basic_info.name: MG Hector
basic_info.description: MG Hector is a 5-seater SUV available at a starting price of Rs. 14 Lakh. The car is available in 20 variants, with 3 engine and 3 transmission option. Additionally, Hector offers a Ground Clearance measurement of 2750 mm and a Boot capacity of 587 liters. You can choose from 7 colors for the Hector. The mileage of the Hector varies from 14.2 - 17.4 KM/L depending on the model.

Introduction: The Hector is a comfortable five-seater SUV with plenty of legroom, headroom, and a big boot.
For minimalism, it boasts a huge touchscreen infotainment system, in fact, the biggest in its segment.
It came in as a mid-size SUV in petrol and diesel engine options.
It continues to get safety features like a 360-degree camera, ABS, stability control, and more.
MG Hector – Exterior: The Hector’s fascia features a large and shiny diamond-pattern grille and chrome accents flanked by slim projector headlights with DRLs.
It rides on 18-inch dual-tone machined alloy wheels shod with radial tubeless tyres.
Moreover, the SUV sports a body cladding around the sides and wheel arches to protect it from scratches.
The roof looks like it floats above the body, giving a sleek side profile.
Blade-style LED taillights connect with a light bar and include sequential turn indicators as well.
MG Hector – Interior: The MG Hector features a huge 14-inch HD portrait infotainment screen, which runs wireless Android Auto, Apple CarPlay, and more.
Then, fancy oak white and black themes with a brushed metal finish give a luxurious vibe.
Front seats are ventilated, with power adjust for driver and passenger, while the rear seats offer good legroom and recline.
To add to the delight, there’s a massive glass roof that floods the cabin with light and gives an airy experience.
Moreover, there’s voice-activated control that lets one open the sunroof hands-free.
The sound and infotainment needs are taken care of by Infinity’s Audio system with a crisp audio for music or calls.
Other notable features include a cooled glovebox, USB chargers in the front and back, and a central armrest storage.
MG Hector – Powertrain: The Hector is powered by a 1.5-litre turbocharged petrol engine churning 144.9bhp and 250Nm of torque.
This mill comes mated to either a six-speed manual or automatic transmission.
There’s also a diesel model powered by 2.0-litre turbocharged diesel engine delivering 172.3bhp and 350Nm of torque.
This model is available with a six-speed manual gearbox only.
Both models are front-wheel drive (FWD) and are designed for both city and highway driving performance.

verdict: The2023 MG Hectorbrings significant updates in both technology and safety, making it a standout option in the mid-size SUV segment. While it suffers from some issues like turbo lag and body roll, its advanced features, large infotainment system, and ADAS make it a highly appealing choice for tech-savvy buyers who value comfort and safety. The refreshed design and practical pricing further cement its position as a strong contender in the market.
